title: Alberche
text:
The Alberche is a river in the provinces of <a href="Province%20of%20%C3%81vila">Ávila</a>, <a href="Province%20of%20Madrid">Madrid</a> and <a href="Province%20of%20Toledo">Toledo</a>, central <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. It begins its course at 1,800 m in Fuente Alberche, <a href="San%20Mart%C3%ADn%20de%20la%20Vega%20del%20Alberche">San Martín de la Vega del Alberche</a> municipal term, Ávila Province. It forms the natural division between the <a href="Sierra%20de%20Gredos">Sierra de Gredos</a> and the <a href="Sierra%20de%20Guadarrama">Sierra de Guadarrama</a>, in the <a href="Sistema%20Central">Sistema Central</a>.
The Alberche flows roughly from NW to SE and bends sharply midway in its course to flow from NE to SW. It meets the <a href="Tagus">Tagus</a> a few kilometres east of <a href="Talavera%20de%20la%20Reina">Talavera de la Reina</a>. This river has the following dams along its course: <a href="El%20Burguillo%20Reservoir">Burguillo</a>, <a href="El%20Charco%20del%20Cura%20Reservoir">Charco del Cura</a>, <a href="San%20Juan%20Reservoir">San Juan</a>, Picadas and Cazalegas. Alberche Beach is a sandy beach stretch on the banks of the Alberche River, a favorite spot for vacationers from Madrid.
